manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: This COMMERCIAL CHEF 1.1 cu. ft. microwave oven has 1000W of power, capable of heating and re-heating foods and beverages from 30 seconds to 99 full minutes. Enjoy hot coffee in the morning and a pre-made frozen meal in the evening.

Our countertop microwave comes with ten heat temperature settings to properly heat your food. Quick Cook Menu options include pizza, popcorn, beverages, frozen food and more. Speed Defrost and Defrost by Weight are also options.

Our countertop microwave comes with ten heat temperature settings to properly heat your food. Quick Cook Menu options include pizza, popcorn, beverages, frozen food and more. Speed Defrost and Defrost by Weight are also options.
Your new COMMERCIAL CHEF 1.1 cu. ft. digital microwave will look beautiful in your kitchen thanks to its timeless and stylish stainless steel front design with black cabinet.

Product Specifications Unit dimensions of 21.1" x 15.6" x 11.8" | Unit weight of 37 lbs. 1000W | Digital controls 120V/60Hz/20 amp 10 Heat Settings with 6 Pre-Menu Heating Settings Interior capacity of 1.1 cu. ft. Quickly Heat up Meals & Drinks Coffee, tea, hot cocoa Breakfast oatmeal, eggs & bacon Pre-made meals Fully cook regular & sweet potatoes Chicken, fish, pasta dishes and more!

Is this microwave portable and cordless? Our COMMERCIAL CHEF 1.1 cu. ft. microwave is not cordless and is equipped with a 3-wire cord and 3-prong grounding plug. You may use your new microwave in a variety of indoor settings, but only on flat stable surfaces. How many power levels does the microwave include? Navigate your new countertop microwave with a digital control panel with 10 power levels, as well as 6 one-touch menu buttons to heat common foods like popcorn, beverages, potatoes, pizza, frozen food, and more. How do the Speed Defrost and Cook by Weight settings work? Speed Defrost is a convenient feature that quickly thaws frozen food, where the microwave operates at a lower power level and alternates between short bursts of cooking and periods of rest. Should you stir your food occasionally while microwaving it? Stir foods such as casseroles and vegetables while cooking to distribute heat evenly. Food at the outside of the dish absorbs more energy and heats more quickly, so stir from the outside to the center.

reviews.reviewText: All of my local stores were completely out of WHITE microwaves for some strange reason. Bought this one yesterday, got it delivered today. Already used it 3x! Works excellent!

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice compact microwave!
reviews.reviewText: Easy to use! Looks nice on white countertop! Opening and closing very easy and nothing wrong! Nice space saver and does very good job!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A Compact Kitchen Hero
reviews.reviewText: I recently added the Commercial Chef Countertop Microwave to my kitchen, and for its size and price, it's a solid choice. Here's the lowdown on this little culinary warrior: Compact Yet Spacious: This microwave might be small, but it punches above its weight class with a 1.1 cubic feet capacity. You can easily fit most dinner plates and bowls, making it more versatile than its compact design suggests. Efficient Heating: It's not the flashiest microwave in town, but it does its job efficiently. Whether you're reheating leftovers, defrosting, or whipping up a quick bag of popcorn, it gets the job done. Simple to Use: The controls are straightforward and user-friendly. You won't need a degree in microwave technology to figure it out. It's a no-fuss appliance. Clean and Classic: The white exterior gives it a clean and timeless look that can blend in with any kitchen decor. It won't be an eyesore on your countertop. Decent Build Quality: It doesn't feel like a flimsy piece of plastic. The build quality is decent, and it seems durable enough to withstand regular use. Lacks Advanced Features: If you're after a microwave with tons of fancy features, this isn't it. It's more like the dependable sedan of microwaves, not the sports car with all the bells and whistles. Noisy Operation: While it gets the job done, it can be a bit louder than some of its counterparts. So, if you're looking for a library-level hush while your food cooks, you might be in for a surprise. In conclusion, the Commercial Chef Countertop Microwave is a practical and budget-friendly choice for basic microwave needs. It's not a gourmet chef's dream, but it's the reliable workhorse you need for everyday tasks. If you're okay with a no-frills microwave that gets the job done without breaking the bank, this little guy deserves a spot on your countertop. Four stars for its compact kitchen heroics!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Price is right so stop dawdling and go get one!
reviews.reviewText: Works as it is advertised to do! Haven't had it long but, everything I have "cooked", and subsequently warmed up for my leftovers the next day, were superb. I consider this a major appliance purchase and am so far thrilled with it's functionality! It holds the correct temp and makes my food smell delicious! I am able to poach my eggs gently, crisp up my bacon to my preferred crunchiness, serve it hot and delicious! Highly recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great and looks nice

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love it! 5 major pros, 3 minor cons...
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I bought this to replace a button-based model, and here's what I know after having used this for several months: *Pros 1) Quick and easy to set temp and time. My last microwave took anywhere between 5-10 separate button presses to set power level and cook time; if I pressed the wrong thing, I had to clear and do it all over again. This model is just two turns of a dial, at the most, regardless of what temp or time I want. 2) Power level can be adjusted without stopping the microwave. In addition to reheating tea and leftovers, I do a lot of legit cooking in this - things like rice, quinoa, polenta, potatoes for mashing. That can call for longer, lower cooking times and I love being able to adjust power level at any time without resetting. 3) It's just one quick pleasant "ding" when done. My old digital microwave had 5 piercing beeps that persisted even if I opened the door on the first beep; if not opened, it beeps again. Personally, I don't need such a persistent reminder, especially if I happen to be on a call (I work from home, so this happens more often for me now). I often found myself racing to my previous microwave to turn it off right before it was done so I wouldn't have to hear the super loud beeps. 4) It doesn't slide on the counter since it's not push-operated. My microwave is not backed by a wall. My previous unit would slide on the counter when I push the buttons to set time or open the door, and I was always a little nervous it would get pushed off the counter. Because this one is turn dials, it doesn't get pushed and doesn't slide on the counter. The door opens and closes easily so pushing and pulling on that part is not enough to move the unit. *I'll add that I have another appliance stacked on top of the microwave which adds a little more weight. But even if I didn't, I don't think opening/closing the door would make it slide. 5) The door can be left open to air out. This microwave only lights up while it's running, NOT when the door is open. If I heat something that steams up the inside, I can just leave the door open to air it out so things don't get humid and stinky in there over time. (see photo) 5) My Breville countertop/toaster oven fits perfectly on top. To save space, I wanted a microwave that was just big enough to fit my Breville on top, and this one works perfectly. Most other units I saw on Amazon were much larger than this (more counter space than I wanted to give up), or too small to handle what I need. (see photo) *Cons (very minor) 1) I wish I could more reliably set time under 1 minute. Sometimes I just want to warm a biscuit which takes like 7-10 seconds, but the time dial isn't sensitive enough to accurately set for under 1 minute. In my video, you can see how there's little resistance on the dial, and the microwave doesn't turn on until it's closer to a full minute. Not a deal breaker, I just stand by for those quick heating times. If I turn the dial way up to 2+ minutes then wind down, I can get it to heat at some time under 30 seconds. That's still useful for things that are less sensitive than bread....like reheating a still-warm drink. 2) I wish there were a way to feel when the dial is at one of the whole-minute marks, at least for the first 5 or 10 minutes on the dial, and maybe even for 30 second increments. This would be a great feature especially for folks with any kind of visual impairment since the numbers are small. I'd love this improvement on the power level dial as well - to feel the dial click into place for each of the main power level settings. 3) This microwave does not have a digital display, so it won't be a clock or timer. NBD for me, but wanted to mention in case it matters to some of you. *Overall I like this 2-dial microwave leaps and bounds over any of the button-push models I've ever owned, and am not going back to a push-button style any time soon.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Looks nice, not a lot of power.
reviews.reviewText: The microwave looks very nice. However, the power is lower than what I'm used to, so it takes a full minute longer than what the containers say. With the sleek look comes hard-to-read numbers. I wish the microwave sensed when you used it and had a light-up keypad, but it doesn't.

Love this microwave, but a precaution, plug it into the wall and don't plug into a power tower or ext cord. I did the first time and it shut off the power tower. Since then, works perfect, no problems
Great microwave, functions and size are exactly as described. Powerful, easy to use with a nice sleek look.
You seem to have to double the time for a single potato and to warm a cup of coffee but it just takes getting to know how the machine works best for you.

reviews.reviewTitle: It does what it should do: make things hot fast.
reviews.reviewText: Lots of room inside, lots of power. It will beep several times repeatedly if you forget something after heating it. The only negative I found was the touch pad is not very sensitive and seems slow to accept input, but that isn't a problem worth knocking off a star. Might even be a good feature to prevent accidentally turning it on.
